explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.findings: Technical papers reference addressing data challenges such as low samples per class and unbalanced datasets. These papers also reference that such data challenges can impact model performance across different failure types.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper provides evidence for **fairness** and **transparency**. It supports transparency by documenting the specific machine learning algorithms used (Random Forests, LSTM RNN, Gaussian Mixture Models, Hidden Markov Models), their application context, and details on model parameters and training configurations. The paper also implies fairness considerations by addressing data challenges like low samples per class and unbalanced datasets, which can impact model performance across different failure types.
relevant_sources.title: Sequence-Based Classification for Predictive Maintenance Using PACCAR Data

governance.findings: Policy documents outline rules for the responsible development and deployment of AI systems. PACCAR's 2024 Annual Report references the adoption and advancement of generative AI, machine learning, and predictive analytics, as well as a governance infrastructure for AI applications. Documentation also references the use of AI by an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, the "PACCAR Supplier Code of Conduct," provides evidence for the **governance** and **privacy** pillars of responsible AI. It establishes rules for the responsible development and deployment of AI systems, demonstrating a commitment to governance. Furthermore, the policy explicitly states a commitment to protecting privacy and complying with data protection laws in the context of AI development and deployment, directly supporting the privacy pillar.
relevant_sources.title: PACCAR Supplier Code of Conduct

relevant_sources.summary: This PACCAR 2024 Annual Report provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The report's mention of adopting and advancing generative AI, alongside tools like machine learning and predictive analytics, implies a structured approach and the need for governance over these systems. Furthermore, the explicit mention of AI-powered reports and a governance infrastructure suggests a commitment to transparency in their AI applications.
relevant_sources.title: PACCAR 2024 Annual Report

relevant_sources.summary: This document, "Viaduct-PACCAR Partnership for AI-Powered Predictive Maintenance," provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by mentioning the use of AI by an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and supports transparency by describing an AI capability that predicts service needs, presented as a benefit to vehicle owners.
relevant_sources.title: Viaduct-PACCAR Partnership for AI-Powered Predictive Maintenance

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.findings: Policy documents state a commitment to protecting privacy in the context of AI development and deployment. These documents also state a commitment to complying with data protection laws in this context.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, the "PACCAR Supplier Code of Conduct," provides evidence for the **governance** and **privacy** pillars of responsible AI. It establishes rules for the responsible development and deployment of AI systems, demonstrating a commitment to governance. Furthermore, the policy explicitly states a commitment to protecting privacy and complying with data protection laws in the context of AI development and deployment, directly supporting the privacy pillar.
relevant_sources.title: PACCAR Supplier Code of Conduct

transparency.findings: PACCAR's 2024 Annual Report references AI-powered reports and a governance infrastructure for AI applications. Technical papers document specific machine learning algorithms, their application context, and details on model parameters and training configurations. Additionally, documentation describes an AI capability that predicts service needs, presented as a benefit to vehicle owners.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This PACCAR 2024 Annual Report provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The report's mention of adopting and advancing generative AI, alongside tools like machine learning and predictive analytics, implies a structured approach and the need for governance over these systems. Furthermore, the explicit mention of AI-powered reports and a governance infrastructure suggests a commitment to transparency in their AI applications.

It supports transparency by documenting the specific machine learning algorithms used (Random Forests, LSTM RNN, Gaussian Mixture Models, Hidden Markov Models), their application context, and details on model parameters and training configurations. The paper also implies fairness considerations by addressing data challenges like low samples per class and unbalanced datasets, which can impact model performance across different failure types.

It supports governance by mentioning the use of AI by an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and supports transparency by describing an AI capability that predicts service needs, presented as a benefit to vehicle owners.

summary.overall_findings: Paccar's 2024 Annual Report references AI-powered reports and a governance infrastructure related to AI applications, demonstrating practices in transparency and governance. These disclosures are part of the evidence for 4 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Policy documents further state a commitment to protecting privacy in the context of AI development and deployment, and outline rules for the responsible development and deployment of AI systems. Additionally, technical papers reference addressing data challenges such as low samples per class and unbalanced datasets, which relates to fairness. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability, oversight, and 1 additional pillar, based on a review of 8 publicly available sources.
